bioghist.p: Fred (1875-1946) and Roberta (Brown) (1883-1942) Hope spent 40 years as Presbyterian missionaries in Cameroon, and raised five daughters there. Fred Hope's first wife, Lou Fenton Johnson Hope, also went to Cameroon to work for the mission with her husband, but died after being there for a short period. Edward Guthmann, the grandson of Fred and Roberta Hope, directed a documentary video about the family's experiences as missionaries, entitled Return to Cameroun.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of letters of Fred and Roberta Hope, written from the mission field in Cameroon. The letters date from 1907 to 1919 (missing 1909 and 1910) and are addressed to relatives in the United States. There are some early letters from Fred and Lou Hope. Many were sent from their post in Batanga (Elat), Cameroon, though some were sent during furloughs in the United States or in transit to Africa. The correspondence was used in Edward Guthmann's video project, Return to Cameroun.
